assumptions: target_env defaulted to dev-like local shell environment
baseline_slo and target_load not provided by runner

evidence: File: "pyproject.toml:1-17" snippet:"project metadata and python dependencies"
File: "pyproject.toml:63-67" snippet:"project.scripts bnsyn and setuptools build-system"
File: "docs/REPO_STRUCTURE.md:10-18" snippet:"top-level directories list has no db service"
File: "docs/API_CONTRACT.md:1-23" snippet:"public API is module list"

lovable_to_prod_delta: Repository is not a marketplace monorepo; lacks frontend/backend/account/payment components.
No auth/RBAC/multi-tenant boundaries for SaaS workflows.
No API contract for web clients (OpenAPI/GraphQL) corresponding to marketplace flows.

criteria.title: Toolchain pinned (node/python/go + package managers)
criteria.rationale: Python and tooling are pinned for CI/release (3.11, setuptools), but local runtime observed is Python 3.12.12 so full hermetic pinning is not demonstrated.

criteria.title: Lockfiles present + enforced in install/build
criteria.rationale: A hash-pinned lockfile exists and CI explicitly recompiles and checks for drift.

criteria.title: Clean build succeeds with proof
criteria.rationale: Local build execution failed because the build module is missing in the current environment.

criteria.title: Unit tests exist + runnable
criteria.rationale: A substantial pytest suite exists, but local run failed during collection due missing dependencies (hypothesis/pyyaml/psutil).
evidence: File: "pyproject.toml:19-51" snippet:"optional dependencies include pytest, hypothesis, pyyaml, psutil"
File: "docs/TESTING.md:15-25" snippet:"canonical test command make test / pytest"

criteria.title: Integration/e2e for critical paths (auth + purchase/entitlement + download)
criteria.rationale: Repository scope is a deterministic neuroscience simulation library; no evidence of marketplace auth/purchase/download e2e flows.
evidence: File: "docs/REPO_STRUCTURE.md:10-18" snippet:"top-level dirs are src/tests/scripts/docs etc."
File: "docs/API_CONTRACT.md:5-23" snippet:"stable API is Python modules, not web endpoints"

criteria.title: Coverage signal or justified absence
criteria.rationale: Coverage commands and gates exist (coverage.xml generation and threshold checks), but no passing local coverage execution was captured in this run.
evidence: File: "docs/TESTING.md:85-124" snippet:"coverage artifact and gate behavior"

criteria.title: PR checks run (build+tests+lint/typecheck)
criteria.rationale: PR workflow includes build, tests, lint, mypy, pylint, determinism, and smoke matrix jobs.

criteria.title: Release/versioning strategy + artifacts
criteria.rationale: Release dry-run pipeline and version-bump checks are defined; rollback/runbook specifics are limited.
evidence: File: "docs/RELEASE_PIPELINE.md:3-34" snippet:"deterministic release stages and bump flow"
File: ".github/workflows/release-pipeline.yml:27-53" snippet:"build and upload release dry-run artifacts"

criteria.title: Secret hygiene: no plaintext secrets + scanning configured
criteria.rationale: Gitleaks policy and security targets are configured, but no successful local security scan execution evidence was captured in this run.
evidence: File: ".gitleaks.toml:1-35" snippet:"strict gitleaks policy with bounded allowlist"

criteria.title: AuthN/AuthZ correctness signals (RBAC, guards, API authorization)
criteria.rationale: No server-side authN/authZ or RBAC implementation is evident for marketplace workflows.

criteria.title: Multi-tenant isolation + data access scoping evidence
criteria.rationale: No tenant data model, tenant scoping middleware, or tenant-aware persistence layer was found.

criteria.title: Payment security/entitlements integrity (no trust-on-client)
criteria.rationale: No payment processor integration or entitlement state handling exists in repository artifacts.
evidence: File: "docs/API_CONTRACT.md:1-4" snippet:"BN-Syn API contract for library modules"

criteria.title: Security policy + dependency vuln scanning
criteria.rationale: Dependency review and CodeQL workflows are present in CI.
evidence: File: ".github/workflows/dependency-review.yml:1-29" snippet:"dependency review action on dependency diffs"

criteria.title: Browse/search/catalog correctness + pagination/filtering contract
criteria.rationale: No marketplace browse/search/catalog API contracts were found.
evidence: File: "docs/API_CONTRACT.md:5-23" snippet:"Python package modules listed as API"

criteria.title: Purchase → entitlement → download is atomic/idempotent
criteria.rationale: No purchase, entitlement, or download transaction flow exists in the detected architecture.

criteria.title: Custom request workflow state machine (status transitions, auditability)
criteria.rationale: No custom-request lifecycle state machine or audit trail for such workflow found.
evidence: File: "docs/ARCHITECTURE.md:20-27" snippet:"control loops are neuroscience simulation loops"

criteria.title: Admin/moderation controls + abuse handling
criteria.rationale: No admin moderation control plane or abuse workflow artifacts were detected.
evidence: File: "docs/REPO_STRUCTURE.md:10-18" snippet:"project structure lacks admin web/backend modules"

criteria.title: p95 latency & error budget instrumentation exists (or measurement harness)
criteria.rationale: Performance harness exists for simulation benchmarks, but no web/API SLO instrumentation for p95/error budgets is present.

criteria.title: Profiling/critical path analysis capability (server + DB query visibility)
criteria.rationale: Kernel profiling/benchmark artifacts exist for simulation pathways, but no service/DB profiling stack is present.

criteria.title: Rate limiting, retries/timeouts, backpressure signals
criteria.rationale: No API gateway/server middleware evidence for rate limits/retries/backpressure in marketplace context.

criteria.title: Cost controls (caching, pagination limits, storage policies)
criteria.rationale: Some workload controls exist in benchmark scenarios, but no production SaaS cost-control policy (pagination/storage TTL/cache strategy) was found.

criteria.title: README: setup/run/test + env config
criteria.rationale: README and testing docs provide setup/run/test guidance with explicit commands.
evidence: File: "README.md:1-40" snippet:"project overview and quality links"

criteria.title: Architecture notes/ADR + onboarding
criteria.rationale: Architecture and governance documentation is extensive and cross-referenced.

criteria.title: Ops runbook (deploy/rollback/incident)
criteria.rationale: Release pipeline documentation exists, but comprehensive incident/rollback operational runbooks are limited for SaaS operations.
evidence: File: "docs/RELEASE_PIPELINE.md:1-34" snippet:"release dry-run and bump workflow"

top_blockers.title: Repository scope mismatch vs target product (no marketplace stack)
top_blockers.fix: Create/ingest dedicated marketplace backend/frontend modules (catalog, auth, payments, entitlements, downloads) and wire tests for critical flows.

top_blockers.title: Build reproducibility unproven in current environment
top_blockers.fix: Install pinned build dependencies and re-run clean `python -m build` with artifact hash capture in proof bundle.

top_blockers.title: Tests not runnable in local gate due missing dependencies
top_blockers.fix: Run `python -m pip install -e ".[test]"` (or lockfile install) before pytest and record passing output + coverage.

top_blockers.title: No authN/authZ and multi-tenant controls for SaaS
top_blockers.fix: Implement server-side auth, RBAC policy checks, and tenant-scoped persistence with automated authorization tests.

top_blockers.title: No payment/entitlement integrity path
top_blockers.fix: Introduce server-authoritative purchase→entitlement transaction model with idempotency keys and downloadable asset authorization.

top_blockers.title: Reliability controls for API traffic absent
top_blockers.fix: Add API-layer rate limiting, timeout/retry policies, health checks, and SLO dashboards (p95 latency/error rate).

next_actions.action: Stand up minimal production marketplace service boundaries (auth, catalog, orders, entitlements, downloads).
steps: Define OpenAPI contracts for critical paths.
Implement server-side handlers with idempotency + authorization.
Add integration tests for auth and purchase→download flows.
evidence_targets: Server-side policy checks in code + tests

next_actions.action: Restore reproducible local build/test gate with lockfile-based environment bootstrap.
steps: Run python -m build and pytest/coverage commands.
Record outputs and artifact hashes in proof bundle.
Add health/readiness endpoints and structured logs.
Define and validate rate limiting/timeout behavior under load tests.

next_actions.action: Formalize security posture for SaaS workloads.
steps: Add authz tests for protected endpoints.
Enable continuous vulnerability scanning and secret scanning in required checks.
Document incident response and key rotation runbook.
evidence_targets: CI required-check config including security jobs
